quotes: From 1995 to 2011, he served as a senator, representing the Hauts-de-Seine département.
In 1989, he participated in an edition of the Antenne 2 talk show Apostrophes devoted to human rights, together with the 14th Dalai Lama.
Badinter met with the Dalai Lama many times, in particular in 1998 when he greeted him as the 'Champion of Human Rights',
Badinter met with the Dalai Lama many times, in particular in 1998 when he greeted him as the 'Champion of Human Rights', and again in 2008.
In 1991, Badinter was appointed by the Council of Ministers of the European Community as a member of the Arbitration Commission of the Peace Conference on Yugoslavia.

quotes: Badinter was the first president of the Court of Conciliation and Arbitration of the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE) following its creation in 1995; he served in that position until 2013.
He supported full recognition of the Republic in 1992.

roles.title: head of the Arbitration Commission
quotes: As a head of the Arbitration Commission, he gained high respect among Macedonians and other ethnic groups in the Republic of Macedonia because he recommended 'that the use of the name 'Macedonia' cannot therefore imply any territorial claim against another State'.
From 1995 to 2011, he served as a senator, representing the Hauts-de-Seine département.
Discussing the disappearance of Tibetan culture from Tibet, Badinter used the term 'cultural genocide'.
He was elected as president of the commission by the four other members, all presidents of constitutional courts in the European Community.
The Arbitration Commission has rendered eleven pieces of advice regarding 'major legal questions' arising from the split of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
Badinter opposed the accession of Turkey to the European Union, on the grounds that Turkey might not be able to follow the rules of the Union.

locations.place: Georgia, Armenia, Iran, Iraq and Syria
quotes: We'll have, we Europeans, common borders with Georgia, Armenia, Iran, Iraq and Syria. I am asking you: What justifies our common borders with these countries? What justifies that we'd get involved in the most dangerous areas of the world?

As a head of the Arbitration Commission, he gained high respect among Macedonians and other ethnic groups in the Republic of Macedonia because he recommended 'that the use of the name 'Macedonia' cannot therefore imply any territorial claim against another State'.

supporting_quotes: From 1995 to 2011, he served as a senator, representing the Hauts-de-Seine département.
In 1991, Badinter was appointed by the Council of Ministers of the European Community as a member of the Arbitration Commission of the Peace Conference on Yugoslavia.

As a head of the Arbitration Commission, he gained high respect among Macedonians and other ethnic groups in the Republic of Macedonia because he recommended 'that the use of the name 'Macedonia' cannot therefore imply any territorial claim against another State'.

Badinter was the first president of the Court of Conciliation and Arbitration of the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE) following its creation in 1995; he served in that position until 2013.
